camel.sink.endpoint.cacheConfigurationPr.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cacheConfigurationProperties
camel.sink.endpoint.cacheConfigurationPr.description: The Properties for the javax.cache.spi.CachingProvider to create the CacheManager

camel.sink.endpoint.cachingProvider.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cachingProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.cachingProvider.description: The fully qualified class name of the javax.cache.spi.CachingProvider

camel.sink.endpoint.configurationUri.name: camel.sink.endpoint.configurationUri
camel.sink.endpoint.configurationUri.description: An implementation specific URI for the CacheManager

camel.sink.endpoint.readThrough.name: camel.sink.endpoint.readThrough
camel.sink.endpoint.readThrough.description: If read-through caching should be used

camel.sink.endpoint.storeByValue.name: camel.sink.endpoint.storeByValue
camel.sink.endpoint.storeByValue.description: If cache should use store-by-value or store-by-reference semantics

camel.sink.endpoint.writeThrough.name: camel.sink.endpoint.writeThrough
camel.sink.endpoint.writeThrough.description: If write-through caching should be used

camel.sink.endpoint.action.name: camel.sink.endpoint.action
camel.sink.endpoint.action.description: To configure using a cache operation by default. If an operation in the message header, then the operation from the header takes precedence.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.createCacheIfNotExis.name: camel.sink.endpoint.createCacheIfNotExists
camel.sink.endpoint.createCacheIfNotExis.description: Configure if a cache need to be created if it does exist or can't be pre-configured.

camel.sink.endpoint.lookupProviders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lookupProviders
camel.sink.endpoint.lookupProviders.description: Configure if a camel-cache should try to find implementations of jcache api in runtimes like OSGi.

camel.component.jcache.cacheConfiguratio.name: camel.component.jcache.cacheConfigurationPropertiesRef
camel.component.jcache.cacheConfiguratio.description: References to an existing Properties or Map to lookup in the registry to use for configuring jcache.

camel.component.jcache.cachingProvider.name: camel.component.jcache.cachingProvider
camel.component.jcache.cachingProvider.description: The fully qualified class name of the javax.cache.spi.CachingProvider

camel.component.jcache.configurationUri.name: camel.component.jcache.configurationUri
camel.component.jcache.configurationUri.description: An implementation specific URI for the CacheManager

camel.component.jcache.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.jcache.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.jcache.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.jcache.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.jcache.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.jcache.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
